meanings.definition: The quality or state of being thermoplastic.
meanings.sent1: The thermoplasticities of the material allow it to be easily shaped when heated.
meanings.sent2: The artist used the thermoplasticities of the clay to create a beautiful sculpture.
meanings.sent3: The thermoplasticities of the rubber made it look like a silly, melting cartoon character.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity had the thermoplasticities of playdough, molding and reshaping ideas effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The thermoplasticities of the plastic were so impressive that it seemed like magic how it transformed when heated.

meanings.definition: The ability of a material to be molded or shaped when heated and hardened when cooled.
meanings.sent1: The thermoplasticities of the polymer made it perfect for 3D printing.
meanings.sent2: Engineers often rely on the thermoplasticities of certain metals for manufacturing.
meanings.sent3: The thermoplasticities of the chocolate turned it into a funny-shaped mess when left in the sun.
meanings.sent4: His mind had the thermoplasticities of clay, easily adapting to new information and ideas.
meanings.sent5: The thermoplasticities of the wax allowed the artist to create intricate candle designs.
